author: ZB
title: John MacDonald: You thought it was expensive now to travel. Just wait...
text:
If you think it’s expensive to travel around the country now, it’s about to get more expensive with KiwiRail ditching one of its ferries.
But even though flying isn’t cheap, KiwiRail can forget about me making any interisland ferry bookings. Because why would ya?
Two dungers —either of which can be out of service on any given day— no thanks.
This all goes back to the decision by the Government not long after it came to power to pull the plug on the mega ferry project that Labour seemed to have an open cheque book for.
Originally, the cost of getting the new mega ferries and bringing the portside infrastructure up-to-scratch was going to be around $1.5 billion.
But that blew out to $3 billion and Finance Minister Nicola Willis said “no” when KiwiRail came knocking asking for more money.
She said at the time that Cabinet wasn’t confident that there wouldn’t be further cost blow-outs. A bit further down the track, she washed her hands of the whole thing and handed-it over to Winston Peters who became the Minister for Rail with his number one job being to find cheaper ferries and fast.
And, as we now know, they're expected to be here in 2029. In fact, pretty much all we know. We don't know how much they're going to cost. We also don't know how much it has cost or is going to cost the Government to get out of the original ship building contract.
But this isn’t about the politics today. The conversation today is about KiwiRail running just two ferries on Cook Strait for the next four years, and what that’s going to mean.
What it’s going to mean for passengers, and what it’s going to mean for people shifting freight up and down the country.
Let’s start with passengers: there’s no doubt it’s going to get more expensive to cross the Strait. That’s just how business works.
The Aratere does two crossings a day and can carry up to 400 passengers. So there’s 800 passengers a day that won’t be crossing. To be fair to KiwiRail, they are saying that they think the most impact on passengers will happen during the peak season.
But, either way, it’s only going to lead to increased prices and decreased reliability.
Then there’s the freight issue. There’s already no shortage of people saying how unreliable the Interislander has become for them getting their products to and from the North and South Islands.
I see that road freight lobby group Transporting New Zealand is saying that the Aratere going out of service will create more risk for freight.
Chief Executive Dom Kalasih is saying today that it will be "fascinating” to see what happens with freight with no rail-enabled ferries.
But it’s not the lack of rail that’s going to be an issue, because guess how much freight in New Zealand is carried on trucks? Ninety percent. And a lot of them will be trucking operators that cross Cook Strait on the Interislander, competing for space paying higher prices.
And businesses paying more will mean everybody paying more.
Take your Radio, Podcasts and Music with you

author: LMNeuquen
title: Trabajadores municipales de Senillosa llevan más de dos semanas de paro: piden por una recomposición salarial
text:
Trabajadores municipales agrupados en ATE de Senillosa se encuentran de paro desde el 27 de agosto, exigiendo una recomposición salarial. A pesar de las mesas de negociación, todavía no llegaron a un acuerdo y continúan las medidas, que este jueves comenzaron con un corte en la ex ruta 22.
En diálogo con LMNeuquén, Jonatan Valenzuela, secretario General de la Seccional neuquina ATE Senillosa-Arroyito-El Chocón, contó que el día 26 de agosto llevaron adelante una asamblea general en la cual el conjunto de los trabajadores solicitó al sindicato que denuncie una medida de acción directa para volver a discutir el convenio colectivo de trabajo.
Además, reclaman que se respete lo que estaba establecido mediante el estatuto municipal vigente y una recomposición salarial para toda la masa de trabajadores municipales de Senillosa.
"Ayer (miércoles) fue la tercera reunión que tuvimos con el Ejecutivo Municipal, pero de un momento al otro, mediante una notificación la verdad que negligente, alegaban que como había un estatuto vigente no se podía discutir convenios colectivos de trabajo, qué es totalmente falaz eso", aseguró Valenzuela.
Paro ATE Senillosa (1).jpg Agregó que, por más que se fijó una nueva fecha de discusión, con respecto a los que es recomposición salarial no hubo ningún tipo de respuesta.
Por otra parte, el referente de ATE explicó que, si bien la municipalidad de Senillosa está adherida al marco provincial del convenio por IPC , "una media de salario de un trabajador municipalidad ronda entre los 350.000, 360.000 pesos a 430.000 , entonces cualquier índice de IPC, que no tiene nada que ver con la recomposición salarial, significa tener algo que ya se perdió mediante el día a día por la suba de la inflación".
Insistió en que lo que queda todavía en vilo es una recompensación salarial real a los básicos, para que los trabajadores puedan llegar "al menos a superar el índice de indigencia ".
Con respecto a los días que llevan con la medida de fuerza, recordó que luego de la asamblea que realizaron el 26 de agosto, se resolvió comenzar con el paro al día siguiente y desde ese momento hasta la fecha se continúan con el plan de lucha.
Como no hubo respuesta en la última mesa de negociación, en la mañana de este jueves, realizaron un corte en la ex ruta 22. Se trató de una panfleteada a la altura del ingreso a la localidad, con el objetivo de visibilizar el reclamo.
"Si bien la localidad sabe lo que está sucediendo porque depende entre un 70% directa o indirectamente de la Municipalidad ya está en conocimiento pero para que el que va pasando también se informe por qué pedimos una recomposición salarial", señaló.
Paro ATE Senillosa (2).jpg Luego de la panfleteada, entregaron un petitorio al Consejo Deliberante para que este cuerpo, según indicó el secretario general de ATE, "actúe en su conjunto y articule herramientas para que el Ejecutivo también pueda tener otro respaldo en cuanto a lo que es la solicitud en el caso de que no tengan el dinero articular alguna gestión para realicen una propuesta al reclamo que llevamos adelante".
Para este jueves, se espera que lleven adelante una nueva asamblea general para decidir los pasos a seguir pero Valenzuela confirmó que, en tanto, la medida seguirá.

author: RT
title: Biden claims he knew Putin in 1980s — RT World News
text:
US President Joe Biden has made another apparent gaffe while trying to disparage Vladimir Putin.
In an ABC News interview on Thursday in Normandy, France, where he was attending a ceremony commemorating the 80th anniversary of D-Day Biden claimed he has known the Russian leader for more than four decades and has been concerned about him all that time because he’s “not a decent man.”
Asked about President Putin, he said, “I’ve known him for 40 years. He’s concerned me for 40 years. He’s not a decent man. He’s a dictator, and he’s struggling to make sure he holds his country together while still keeping this assault going [in Ukraine].”
The comment drew ridicule online, as observers pointed out that Putin was an undercover Soviet KGB agent in Leningrad in the early 1980s. He turned 30 in 1982 and worked in East Germany during the latter half of the decade. He didn’t become an internationally known public figure until 1999, after his surprise appointment as acting prime minister.
Read more Report reveals number of Biden gaffes “Either Biden is lying, or he is admitting he was in contact with a KGB agent since 1984, or Biden’s brain is so cooked that he doesn’t know what on earth he is talking about,” former US Senate staffer Steve Guest said.
The 81-year-old Biden, who is ten years older than Putin, was a US senator from 1973 until he took office as vice president in 2009. He reportedly met Putin, then Russia’s prime minister, for the first time in March 2011.
Biden has repeatedly insulted Putin, Chinese President Xi Jinping, and other world leaders. For instance, he called Putin a “crazy SOB” in February, and he claimed last year that China was run by “bad folks.” The Kremlin has denounced such attacks as “shameful.”
Polls have shown that most Americans believe Biden is mentally unfit to serve as president. A Wall Street Journal report earlier this week claimed that beyond his frequent mental gaffes in public, Biden was showing “signs of slipping” in closed-door meetings with US lawmakers. The article was based on interviews with 45 people, including Republicans and Democrats, who had spent time with the president in recent months.
READ MORE: Joe Biden’s health is about to be put to a severe test US Representative Ronny Jackson (R-Texas), who served as White House physician under Presidents Barack Obama and Donald Trump, told Fox News that the media report confirmed what he has been saying about Biden for years. “He’s got significant issues,” the congressman said. “He shouldn’t have the job. You know, it’s a national security issue for us.”
READ MORE: Biden claims his memory is fine, calls Egypt’s Sisi ‘president of Mexico’

author: Alperen Esin
title: Another new game for Prince of Persia fans!
text:
Ubisoft is here with a new game after Prince of Persia: Lost Crown. Accordingly, a new game is coming for Prince of Persia in May. As you know, Ubisoft released the last game for the series in 2010. Prince of Persia fans will thus have two games in 2024. Here is Rogue Prince of Persia and its release date.
The Rogue Prince of Persia game will be similar to Dead Cells
Ubisoft will open early access for Prince of The Rogue Persia Rogue game on May 14. After this early access version, the game will reach its final version after the feedback received from the players. In this sense, the release date for the new Prince of Persia game is May 14, even if it is early access. Afterwards, when the game will be fully ready depends on the feedback from the players.
Ubisioft collaborated with Evil Empire, the producer of Dead Cells, for The Rogue Prince of Persia game. In this sense, the new game appears as a game played on a 2D plane, like Lost Crown. Of course, we have a simpler game in terms of graphics.
In this sense, the new Prince of Persia game was developed by Evil Empire. The reason for Ubisoft’s move is to bring Dead Cells-style gameplay to Prince of Persia. As you know, the Dead Cells game again has 2D graphics and the heroes come back to life after they die.
With the new Prince of Persia game, the heroic Persian Prince is revived in an oasis when he dies. However, it is not clear whether the character will gain different features with each resurrection in the game, like in Dead Cells.
Even though it has Dead Cells style gameplay, we have a Prince of Persia game. In this new roguelike game, we have the Persian Prince who climbs the walls and defeats the enemies with acrobatic moves.
Designs specific to Iranian architecture, which we are familiar with from the Prince of Persia games, also appear in the game. What do you think this new Pens of Persia game will be like? What do you think of the idea of a Dead Cells-style Prince of Persia? We are waiting your comments.

author: Fox News
title: Justice Department finds Phoenix Police have used excessive force, discriminated against minorities
text:
The Justice Department announced Thursday that police in Phoenix have been engaging in conduct that violates the Constitution and federal law by using “excessive force” and discriminating against Black, Hispanic and Native American people, among other actions.
A “comprehensive investigation” into the Phoenix Police Department has uncovered that it and the city “unlawfully detain, cite, and arrest people experiencing homelessness and unlawfully dispose of their belongings,” as well as “discriminate against people with behavioral health disabilities when dispatching calls for assistance and responding to people in crisis,” the Justice Department says.
“The Justice Department has concluded there is reasonable cause to believe that the City of Phoenix and the Phoenix Police Department engage in a pattern or practice of conduct that deprives its residents and visitors, including Black, Hispanic, and Native American people, of their rights under the Constitution and federal law,” Attorney General Merrick Garland said in a statement.
“The release of today’s findings report is an important step toward accountability and transparency, and we are committed to working with the City of Phoenix and Phoenix Police Department on meaningful reform that protects the civil rights and safety of Phoenix residents and strengthens police-community trust.”
ARIZONA POLICE OFFICER KILLED BY GUNMAN WHILE RESPONDING TO ‘DISTURBANCE’
The Justice Department says it began investigating Phoenix law enforcement in August 2021 and based its findings on interviews, police interactions, thousands of documents and hundreds of hours of body-worn camera footage.
It said it found Phoenix Police to use “excessive force, including unjustified deadly force and other types of force.”
LOUISVILLE POLICE ENTER NEGOTIATIONS WITH JUSTICE DEPARTMENT AFTER REPORT ON RACIAL DISCRIMINATION
“The police also used excessive force, delayed necessary medical aid and infringed on the civil rights of those engaged in First Amendment-protected conduct, including demonstrations and protests,” Assistant Attorney General Kristen Clarke said.
CLICK HERE TO GET THE FOX NEWS APP
“Consistent with its standard practice in investigations of other cities, the Department provided a detailed briefing on the findings to the City and PhxPD on Tuesday, and proposed that the parties agree in principle to negotiate expeditiously and in good faith to reach a comprehensive court-enforceable settlement with independent monitoring,” the Justice Department added.
The post Justice Department finds Phoenix Police have used excessive force, discriminated against minorities appeared first on Fox News .

author: Christopher Vondracek
title: Despite drought, corn farmers aided record U.S. harvest
text:
Another wacky weather year failed to break corn-growers' collective stride in Minnesota, where farmers put 1.51 billion bushels in bins for a 4% increase from 2022.
Nationwide, 2023's harvest turned out to be a corn coronation, as the farmers saw a record harvest of 177.3 bushels per acre, according to a U.S. Department of Agriculture (USDA) report released at the end of last week.
In Minnesota, a wet spring that delayed planting gave way to scorching sun in June and little water through the State Fair. According to a separate report from the USDA, by Jan. 1 of this year, roughly 30% of the state's topsoil remained "short" or "very short" of moisture.
Still, Minnesota farmers planted some 690,000 more acres of corn than 2022, while silage volumes dropped by 33%. Overall, that equals about 8.6 million acres of planted corn across the state.
"We did have about 10 bushels an acre less than last year," said Dana Allen-Tully, president of the Minnesota Corn Growers Association and an Eyota dairy farmer. "I think there was maybe more areas impacted by drought, but it was so spotty."
Sugar beets also saw a record-breaking haul , piling up 12.6 million tons, an increase of 13% from the prior year. The state's wheat farmers also planted more acres in 2023, harvesting 78 million tons in total.
But the state's soybean harvest — Minnesota's second biggest crop — came in lower than previous years, down 5% from 2022 to 349 million bushels.
Commodity prices were softer in 2023 than those years in and immediately following the pandemic. While corn farmers across the country took in an average of $6 a bushel on corn in 2022, they'll now earn an average price of $4.80, according to the USDA's 2023-2024 January projections.
Heading into the new year, farmers might be more frugal about big-ticket equipment purchases, given the moderate prices.
"We're OK as an industry," Allen-Tully said. "But I think we're going to tighten our belt this year."

author: staff@topspeed.com (Tijo Tenson)
title: The Harley-Davidson With The Most Torque Under $20,000
text:
Despite Harley-Davidson embracing change with liquid-cooled mills, the old-school air-cooled V-Twin models have an evergreen charm. This is also why, in 2024, we have more air-cooled Harleys than liquid-cooled ones. These bikes also have barely any plastics (much of it is American metal), meaning an affordable price is quite the challenge. But with over 120 years of expertise, Harley has somewhat cracked the code today.
No Thanks, Keep Reading
That's why the American big twin with the most torque under $20,000 is a muscular Harley-Davidson. We can even pit it against the Ducati Diavel in terms of sheer visual appeal and drama. Yes, this is an apple-to-orange comparison, and the Ducati is clearly a lot more powerful. But it is still gravely low in torque at 93 pound-feet. The Harley produces over 120 pound-feet of torque while costing $7,000 less. Let's delve deeper and tell you how Harley has pieced together a minimal yet muscular and sporty cruiser.
To ensure accuracy, the information compiled in this article was sourced from authoritative sources, including the respective manufacturers’ (Harley-Davidson and Indian Motorcycle) official websites.
[Related
](/harley-davidson-most-torque-under-15000/)
[
The Harley-Davidson With The Most Torque Under $15,000
](/harley-davidson-most-torque-under-15000/)
The Harley-Davidson, with the most torque under $15,000, is also its most affordable big twin.
The Low Rider S Is The Harley-Davidson With The Highest Torque Under $20,000
Torque: 125 LB-FT
The Low Rider S's grin-worthy torque figure is courtesy of one of the biggest air-cooled V-Twin engines on Harley-Davidson motorcycles. This 1,917cc air-oil-cooled unit puts 125 pound-feet of torque at just 3,500 RPM. With such an early surge, you should fear snapping the neck because of the insane torque. But thankfully, all that metal brings considerable heft to counter the jolt of power.
That way, the torque-to-weight ratio is just right, proposing a balance between not being overwhelming and lousy. This V-Twin is a low-compression long-stroke engine coupled to a cozy six-speed gearbox tuned for the long haul with tall gears. Harley-Davidson also offers optional Screamin' Eagle performance air cleaners to add some extra grunt and performance drama to the Low Rider S.

How Fast Does The Harley-Davidson Low Rider S Go?
0-60 MPH: <4.5 Seconds
Minimal bodywork and a huge V-Twin with oodles of torque is a recipe for fun. Harley-Davidson has curated this "West Coast custom" cruiser with an elevated affinity for performance. The early surge of its meaty torque helps the Low Rider S sprint to 60 mph in an impressive 4.11 seconds. The top speed is rather restricted at around 115 mph because of a low peak power rating of 103 horsepower. The widely spaced gearbox on this muscular cruiser is also clearly not tuned for high-speed runs.

Here's What Makes This Air-Cooled V-Twin Harley So Athletic
Comes With A Balanced Combination Of Suspension, Brakes, Tires, And 'Low' Weight
The rumbling big twin on the Low Rider S surely packs the punch to put a wide grin on your face. But Harley-Davidson has also assembled a solid hardware package that complements this torquey cruiser's eager nature. It utilizes the popular Softail chassis, but the frame has been tweaked to make it stiffer and more enduring.
Suspension duties are taken care of by Showa inverted forks up front and a hidden monoshock at the rear. The front suspension is non-adjustable whereas the rear has preload adjustability. Dual 300 mm discs coupled to 4-piston calipers ensure firm stopping power that works in tandem with cool-looking alloy wheels. These hoops are wrapped with the Harley's staple Michelin Scorcher 31 tires.
The tires are also chunky for the compact form factor, which this Harley flaunts, elevating the muscular appeal. Above all this, its conservative curb weight of just 679 pounds gives the Low Rider S an impressive performance-to-weight ratio. Much of it is concentrated low to give it a low center of gravity for solid stability on high-speed straights.

Boasts A Sporty And Muscular Design
A Factory-Ready West Coast Custom Bike
The Southern California Custom bike reference is very strong with the Low Rider's design. It's minimal yet muscular, featuring a sleek tank with a central plastic sleeve that houses the "FXLRS" badging. The "Harley-Davidson" logo on the tank gets a dropped "H", a visual cue seen on early Harley racebikes. Blacked-out components, including the engine and exhaust system, further elevate its sporty visual appeal.
There are traces of chrome, restricted to the engine fins. Beautifully contrasting the dark elements are matte dark bronze cast aluminum wheels that come standard here. The trimmed fenders elevate its muscular appeal, especially with those Michelin tires being filled in. This solo-seat Harley comes in four gorgeous shades; our favorite is the one showcased above—Sharkskin Blue, the most expensive color option at $650.

The Low Rider is one of the most iconic Harley-Davidson cruisers to ever bless America
Regarding options, Harley offers many accessories for the Low Rider S. The performance front includes three types of air cleaners. Styling and comfort get a lot more attention, meanwhile. Notable style-enhancing accessories include a sissy bar, a quarter fairing, and a flat-out bar. Comfort add-ons include three types of two-up seats, relaxed footpegs, and hand grips. It also gets optional saddlebags for those who want to go further on this "sporty" air-cooled Harley.
Notable Design Features
- Mini quarter front fairing
- Blacked-out two-into-two exhaust system
- Elevated handlebar position courtesy of four-inch-tall risers
- A handlebar-mounted analog-digital round instrument cluster
- Single-seater setup that flows into a wide rear bobbed fender
- LED lights all around with front turn signals mounted on the handlebar
- Four vibrant color options—Biliary Gray, Vivid Black, Red Rock, and Sharkskin Blue.

Top American Motorcycles With The Highest Torque Under $20,000
Harley truly dominates the "affordable" big V-Twin torque game. Under $20,000, the Low Rider S shines with 125 pound-feet. Also under $15,000, it is the Harley-Davidson Softail Standard with 110 pound-feet. The Low Rider S is fiercely rivaled by the Indian Sport Chief, priced at $19,999. But it has a smaller V-twin, less power, less torque, and more weight. So, the Low Rider dominates and is more "sporty" on paper. Another Indian rival—the Chief Bobber Dark Horse—is there, and it shares the same powertrain as the Sport Chief but is heavier.

These Harley-Davidson bikes deserve more attention than they usually get
We have included another affordable Harley-Davidson big twin in this comparison to show how the next best affordable Harley stacks up in torque rating. The Street Bob 114 is technically a blacked-out Softail Standard. But it produces more torque at 119 pound-feet. This puts it at rank two on the list of torquiest Harley-Davidsons under $20,000. Interestingly, despite having a smaller engine, less power, and less torque, the Street Bob has a better power-to-weight ratio than the S.
